body:
**What happened**:
In our kubernetes cluster, there are some slave nodes whose root partition has a very little disk space,  so we add another larger-size disk device and symbolically link `/var/lib/kubelet/pods` to a directory located at this larger device. however, kubelet failed to delete orphaned pod directory,  there are lots of spam logging as below:
```shell
E0617 13:33:39.955783  130511 kubelet_volumes.go:140] cannot delete directory /var/lib/kubelet/pods/000acdf8-7f3b-11e9-87ea-0017fa007527: it is a mount point : There were a total of 3459 errors similar to this. Turn up verbosity to see them.
E0617 13:33:43.756649  130511 kubelet_volumes.go:133] Failed to remove orphaned pod "77be9771-6524-11e9-8b7a-0017fa007aff" dir; err: cannot delete directory /var/lib/kubelet/pods/77be9771-6524-11e9-8b7a-0017fa007aff: it is a mount point
E0617 13:33:43.756753  130511 kubelet_volumes.go:133] Failed to remove orphaned pod "780914a1-7ef0-11e9-87ea-0017fa007527" dir; err: cannot delete directory /var/lib/kubelet/pods/780914a1-7ef0-11e9-87ea-0017fa007527: it is a mount point
E0617 13:33:43.756858  130511 kubelet_volumes.go:133] Failed to remove orphaned pod "7867edd3-8136-11e9-87ea-0017fa007527" dir; err: cannot delete directory /var/lib/kubelet/pods/7867edd3-8136-11e9-87ea-0017fa007527: it is a mount point
...
```

After diving into this problem, I found the root cause:  the `IsLikelyNotMountPoint` failed to distinguishing the mountpoint when `/var/lib/kubelet/pods` is a symbolic link. 

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/5ae55b992b81bdba6836d57cb7700d7922e3f44c/pkg/util/mount/mount_linux.go#L235-L250

 `IsLikelyNotMountPoint` just compare the device number of the pod directory and its parent directory.  however, using `os.Lstat` to obtain parent directory's device number which doesn't follow the link can lead an incorrect result 

I have done some tests:
```shell

Device: 811h/2065d	Inode: 25165826    Links: 5
```

**What you expected to happen**:
kubelet can successfully delete orphaned pod directory when the kubelet's pods directory symbolically links to another device's directory

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
1. symbolically link  `/var/lib/kubelet` to another disk device's directory
2. create pods and delete them

**Anything else we need to know?**:


**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):

- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:

title: kubelet failed to delete orphaned pod directory when "/var/lib/kubelet/pods" directory symbolically links to another device's directory
